instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.CHRG_BGATE: What is CHRG_BGATE? This is a typo of CHGR_BGATE When you see CHRG_BGATE, assume they meant to type CHGR_BGATE.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message:
get green light but won't power from ac
turns on from batt
tried replacing ISL already but same behavior




<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
pin 2 = 16.5V
pin 27/28 resistance 20
pin 17/18 = 3 ohm 




<TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE</SIGNAL>
pin 4 = 15.5V
pin 1-3=16.5V

all measure ok for resistance
<RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>
<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR>
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>
<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>
<RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR>

its <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> not opening right?
what would prevent it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message:
This board does not power on by itself, you need to use power pads...

What is the voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with only charger???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message: yes i know that, I always test with a kbd, output on <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> was like 1.5V i think, will check again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message: Check PPBUS voltage and for short to GND. <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>/85 may be dead

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message:
nothing on PPBUS with AC
tried another <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> still doing same thing
power getting to there but not going thru
pin 4 supposed to be lower than PPBUS right?
maybe try another ISL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message: I suspect bad soldering or dead <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message: k i'll try another ISL, maybe the new spool is another china special

threads.message: ok one side was a little up, got it flat now. powering on from ac, but still not charging batt. i see the green light flicker a little

threads.message: sorry should of noted in original post, was originally brought in not charging but i was able to run off batt before. so i tried changing ISL now its back to the original behavior, only difference is now you can see green light flicker a little like its trying

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message: You did not answer my question.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message: ok its <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> not allowing it to charge, <SIGNAL>CHRG_BGATE</SIGNAL> is like 12V same as PPVBAT. I tried another mosfet and it is still doing the same thing. would have to be a bad trace to ISL or <CAPACITOR>C7026</CAPACITOR> right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ac
threads.message: Or ISL is not soldered properly.....
